title: Stress Analysis Engineer

pay_input_ranges.title: The pay range for this position is:
pay_input_ranges.blurb: Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.

content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the worldâ€™s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving peopleâ€™s ability to move â€“ whether for work or play.
What we do: 
Our Airframe Structural Analysis & Test team is responsible for performing analysis of airframe structures and works closely with Structural Design, Loads, Payloads/Interiors, Material & Process, Manufacturing Technology, System and Test & Evaluation groups. We are looking for an experienced Stress Analysis Engineer to help build our structural analysis capabilities from the ground up. Our ideal candidate has impressive experience and expertise in structural analysis of airframe primary structures. This position will report to the Airframe Structural Analysis & Test Manager and provide technical solutions for the Airframe Structural Analysis team.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:
Perform stress analysis of aerospace primary and secondary structures made of composite and metallic materials for experimental and type certificated vehicles
Apply free body diagrams, hand calculations and numerical methods for estimating and developing loads
Develop and apply analysis methods for static strength, stability, durability, and damage tolerance
Support development of new manufacturing technologies, engineering tools, and aircraft structural designs
Work closely with design and test engineers to determine test requirements and support vehicle and sub-scale tests
Coordinate and communicate regularly with team members across Supernal to provide and receive updates on project progress, quality metrics, project summaries, and other related documents
Work with minimal supervision to come up with conceptual and detailed analysis based on the requirements
May require up to 10% of domestic and international travel
May require up to 10% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned
What you can contribute:
Bachelor or masterâ€™s degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, Aeronautical, Civil, or equivalent fields
A minimum of three (3) years of experience working with fixed- or rotary-wing aircraft structure strength, stability, fatigue analysis and/or finite element analysis (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)
Experience with composites structures
Experience with analytical tools such as HyperX, Nastran, Abaqus, LS-DYNA, Patran, FEMAP, Hyperworks, 3DX, OptiStruct, NASGRO, Slim/Vision or similar
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Must have the ability to independently prioritize and accomplish work within time constraints
You may also be able to contribute:
Familiarity with industry level composite activities (e.g. NCAMP, CMH17 or P17) is desired
Familiarity with durability and damage tolerance analysis techniques for metallic and/or non-metallic structure is desired
Familiarity with MRB, structural testing, flight test, or analysis automation (e.g. Python programming or similar) is desired
Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other category or class protected under applicable federal, state or local law. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation at: ta-support@supernal.aero
This position may include access to certain technology and/or software source code subject to U.S. export controls laws and regulations. If an export authorization from an applicable US regulatory agency is required in connection with your employment, your employment is contingent upon Supernalâ€™s receipt of such regulatory authorization(s) and your continued compliance with all conditions and limitations pursuant to such authorization(s).Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.The pay range for this position is:$133,120â€”$186,160 USDClick HERE or visit: https://jobs.supernal.aero/benefits to view our benefits!
